intro: Forasaccus racemosus, commonly known as the clustered thornapple, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
